DOC.brief_summary: This prospective , single-arm , open-label , multi-center , observational study ass acute safety efficacy MINI TREK RX 1.20 mm , descriptive purpose .
DOC.brief_title: A Clinical Evaluation MINI TREK RX 1.20 mm Coronary Dilatation Catheter Stenotic Lesions
DOC.detailed_description: CAUTION : Investigational device limit Federal ( U.S. ) law investigational use
DOC.criteria: General Inclusion Criteria 1 . Subject must least 18 year age . 2 . Subject legally authorize representative must provide write informed consent prior study related procedure . 3 . Subject must stenotic lesion ( ) native coronary artery bypass graft suitable percutaneous coronary intervention . 4 . Subject must single multiple vessel coronary artery disease clinical evidence myocardial ischemia ( e.g. , stable unstable angina silent ischemia document positive functional study ) . 5 . Subject must acceptable candidate CABG . 6 . Subject must agree undergo protocolrequired followup procedure . 7 . Subject must agree participate clinical study hospitalization index procedure . Angiographic Inclusion Criteria All angiographic inclusion criterion base visual estimation . 1 . De novo restenotic lesion native coronary artery bypass graft . 2 . A maximum two lesion , include least one target lesion , two major epicardial distribution tree . Tandem lesion , define multiple , focal lesion cover one stent , consider single lesion . 3 . If one target lesion one nontarget lesion treat , target nontarget lesion must locate different major epicardial distribution tree . 4 . The target lesion must diameter stenosis ≥ 70 % visual estimation online quantitative coronary angiography ( QCA ) , may include chronic total occlusion ( CTO ) . 5 . Lesions may locate highly tortuous vessel . General Exclusion Criteria 1 . Subject know diagnosis acute myocardial infarction ( AMI ) within 72 hour precede intended index procedure . 2 . The subject currently experience clinical symptom consistent new onset AMI , prolong chest pain ischemic ECG change unresponsive nitrate . 3 . Subject hemodynamic instability hemodynamically unstable cardiac arrhythmia . 4 . Subject know leave ventricular ejection fraction ( LVEF ) < 30 % recent evaluation ( LVEF may obtain time index procedure value unknown necessary ) . 5 . Subject receive chronic anticoagulation therapy ( e.g. , heparin , coumadin ) . 6 . Subject require Low Molecular Weight Heparin ( LMWH ) within 8 hour time index procedure . 7 . Subject know hypersensitivity contraindication aspirin , heparin/bivalirudin , antiplatelet medication , sensitivity contrast medium , adequately premedicated . 8 . Subject platelet count < 100,000 cells/mm3 > 700,000 cells/mm3 . 9 . Subject serum creatinine level > 2.0 mg/dl within seven day prior index procedure . 10 . Subject cerebrovascular accident/stroke transient ischemic neurological attack ( TIA ) within past six month . 11 . Subject history bleed diathesis coagulopathy refuse blood transfusion . 12 . Subject active peptic ulcer significant gastrointestinal urinary bleed within past six month . 13 . Elective surgery plan hospitalization index procedure require discontinue dual antiplatelet therapy . 14 . Subject medical illness ( e.g. , cancer ) may confound data interpretation associate limited life expectancy . 15 . Subject currently participate investigational study may confound treatment outcome study . 16 . Subject pregnant nursing . Female subject childbearing potential must negative pregnancy test do within 7 day prior index procedure per site standard test . Angiographic Exclusion Criteria All angiographic exclusion criterion base visual estimation . 1 . More two lesion require treatment . Tandem lesion , define multiple , focal lesion cover one stent , consider single lesion . 2 . Target lesion locate unprotected leave main artery . 3 . Coronary artery spasm absence significant stenosis . 4 . Target vessel contains thrombus indicate initial angiographic image . 5 . During index procedure , lesion require additional treatment adjunctive ablative device ( i.e. , rotational directional atherectomy , cut balloon , laser , thrombectomy , etc. ) . 6 . Target lesion involve bifurcation side branch ≥ 2.5 mm diameter , ostial lesion > 40 % stenosed , side branch require protection guide wire predilatation . 7 . Additional clinically significant lesion ( ) coronary artery bypass graft PCI may require hospitalization index procedure .
